ENTRY       EC 2.6.1.71                 Enzyme
NAME        lysine---pyruvate 6-transaminase;
            lysine-pyruvate aminotransferase;
            Lys-AT
CLASS       Transferases;
            Transferring nitrogenous groups;
            Transaminases
SYSNAME     L-lysine:pyruvate aminotransferase
REACTION    L-lysine + pyruvate = (S)-2-amino-6-oxohexanoate + L-alanine [RN:R00453]
ALL_REAC    R00453
SUBSTRATE   L-lysine [CPD:C00047];
            pyruvate [CPD:C00022]
PRODUCT     (S)-2-amino-6-oxohexanoate [CPD:C04076];
            L-alanine [CPD:C00041]
HISTORY     EC 2.6.1.71 created 1990, modified 2011
REFERENCE   1
  AUTHORS   Schmidt, H., Bode, R. and Birnbaum, D.
  TITLE     A novel enzyme, L-lysine : pyruvate aminotransferase, catalyses the first step of lysine catabolism in Pichia guilliermondii.
  JOURNAL   FEMS Microbiol Lett 49:203-206 (1988)
DBLINKS     ExplorEnz - The Enzyme Database: 2.6.1.71
            IUBMB Enzyme Nomenclature: 2.6.1.71
            ExPASy - ENZYME nomenclature database: 2.6.1.71
            BRENDA, the Enzyme Database: 2.6.1.71
            CAS: 114189-79-6
